title: Human error , disregard for signal – what happened before Kanchanjunga Express crash
body_text:
Human error, disregard for signal – what happened before Kanchanjunga Express crash
Nine people died in a train accident in New Jalpaiguri caused by the negligence of the goods train's loco pilot. The automatic signalling system was not working, and trains were given clearance through a manual process. The railway officials blame the loco pilot for ignoring the signal, but the absence of the safety system, Kavach, is also a factor.
